pageContext.publications: Flat Celt 89 mm long of Spanish type, probably copper, smaller but similar to that from near the Dolmens of Mare Kerioned, found on a hut floor. M. Le Rouzie said in association with objects exhibited in same case. viz. Flint arrow-heads mostly barbed and tanged, half a spherical round. (? quartzite, ? soapstone) mace-head, etc. Dr. Clay has a note of 2 flat celts from Lizo found under a wall, I saw and heard of one only. There is also a small rough lump of copper. I am not certain whether M. Le Rouzie really meant that the flat celt(s) (was were) found actually in the same spot as the other objects., Marsille, "Depots de l'Age de Bronze," p.5.
pageContext.site: France, brittany, morbihan, carnac district, west bank of crac'h estuary, settlement of le lizo
